bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Provincial Sales Tax Act;
cannabis has the same meaning as in the Cannabis Control and Licensing Act;
participating savings institution means a savings institution that will accept the payment or remittance of tax imposed under the Act to the account of the government.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Accommodation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "accommodation" in section 1 of the Act, lodging excluded from that paragraph is lodging provided in a unit that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: does not contain a bed, and
is to be used to display merchandise, to entertain or to hold a meeting, dinner or reception.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "accommodation" in section 1 of the Act, the following dwellings are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: lodging houses other than hospitals, assisted living residences as defined in the Community Care and Assisted Living Act and long-term residential care facilities;
bunkhouses, cabins, condominiums, dormitories, hostels, mobile homes, stationary vehicles and vacation homes;
a dwelling operated by a club or association, whether or not a membership is required for use of the dwelling;
that part of a ship or train in which lodging is provided while the ship or train is not in transit or is not making a scheduled stopover in British Columbia;
a residential dwelling.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (e), residential dwelling has the same meaning as in paragraphs (a) to (d), (g) and (h) of the definition of "residential dwelling" in the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, except that definition is to be read without reference to paragraphs (i) to (m), and includes any part of a residential dwelling.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Appraised value

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "appraised value" in section 1 of the Act, the appraised value of a vehicle must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be determined by a person described in subsection (2), and
that person must determine the fair market value of the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following persons are described for the purpose of subsection (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a motor dealer registered under the Motor Dealer Act;
a person authorized under the law of another jurisdiction to carry on business in that jurisdiction in a manner similar to a motor dealer under the Motor Dealer Act;
a person whose business it is to appraise motor vehicles.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Average wholesale value

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, industry standard publication means a publication specified by the director, as the publication is amended from time to time.

For the purposes of the definition of "average wholesale value" in section 1 of the Act, if, at the time an application is made for the registration of the motor vehicle under the vehicle registration legislation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a motor vehicle is listed in the most recent edition of the industry standard publication by make, model, trim and model year, then the average wholesale value is the average wholesale value listed in the most recent edition of the industry standard publication for that motor vehicle for British Columbia, or

a motor vehicle is listed in the most recent edition of the industry standard publication by make, model and trim and the most recent model year listed is an earlier model year of the motor vehicle, then the average wholesale value is the average wholesale value listed in the most recent edition of the industry standard publication for the most recent model year of the motor vehicle for British Columbia.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Eligible tangible personal property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (e) of the definition of "eligible tangible personal property" in section 1 of the Act, cannabis is prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 154/2022, Sch. 1, s. 1.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: E-vaping devices
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "e-vaping device" in section 1 of the Act, a product or device having both of the following characteristics is prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the product or device contains an electronic or battery-powered heating element;
the purpose of the product or device is to heat a heated tobacco product within the meaning of the Tobacco Tax Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fair market value — boats
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (a.1) of the definition of "fair market value" in section 1 of the Act, the property prescribed is the tangible personal property referred to in section 34 (1) [marine safety equipment] of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Lease — incidental right to use tangible personal property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (d) of the definition of "lease" in section 1 of the Act, a right to use tangible personal property is merely incidental to an agreement for the right to use real property, or to an agreement for the provision of services that are not subject to tax under the Act, in the following prescribed circumstances:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of an agreement for the right to use real property,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the term of the right to use the real property is 7 days or less,
there is no separate price for the right to use the tangible personal property, and

the total consideration payable for the right to use the real property, including the right to use the tangible personal property, is the same as, or only marginally different from, what would be the total consideration payable for the right to use the real property if there were no right to use the tangible personal property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of an agreement for the provision of services that are not subject to tax under the Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the fundamental and overriding objective of the agreement is the acquisition of the service and not the right to use the tangible personal property,
there is no separate price for the right to use the tangible personal property, and

the total consideration payable for the service, including the right to use the tangible personal property, is the same as, or only marginally different from, what would be the total consideration payable for the service if there were no right to use the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Liquor permit
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "liquor permit" in section 1 of the Act, the class of permit prescribed is the special event permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meal
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "meal" in section 1 of the Act, the following meals are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a continental breakfast;
a snack.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Passenger vehicle

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "passenger vehicle" in section 1 of the Act, the following motor vehicles are excluded:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a truck that is larger than a 3/4 ton truck;
a van that is larger than a 3/4 ton van;
a camperized van that is designed to be used primarily for accommodation during travel or recreation and that contains built-in sleeping facilities, a built-in stove and one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a built-in sink;
a built-in refrigerator;
a built-in cooler;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a motor home, as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act;
a bus, as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act;
an ambulance;
a hearse;
a motorcycle, as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act, with an engine capacity of 250 cc or less.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "passenger vehicle" in section 1 of the Act, the following vehicles are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a truck that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is or is smaller than a 3/4 ton truck, and
is not designed primarily as a means of transport for individuals;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a van that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is or is smaller than a 3/4 ton van, and
is not designed primarily as a means of transport for individuals;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a station wagon, as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Portable building
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (f) of the definition of "portable building" in section 1 of the Act, the following buildings are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a fabric-covered building;
a fibreglass storage unit;
a cargo container;
a portable toilet building that is self-contained and designed for use by a single person;
a hoop house;
a greenhouse;
a switch house.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Sale — incidental provision of tangible personal property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, original and master mean the first final version and do not include any subsequent copies.

For the purposes of paragraph (k) of the definition of "sale" in section 1 of the Act, the provision of tangible personal property, software or a telecommunication service is merely incidental to a contract for the provision of services that are not subject to tax under the Act in the following prescribed circumstances:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the contract,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the fundamental and overriding objective of the contract is the acquisition of the service and not the acquisition of the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service,
there is no separate purchase price for the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service, and

the total consideration payable for the service, including the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service provided, is the same as, or only marginally different from, what would be the total consideration payable for the service if the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service were not provided;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service is an original blueprint provided by an engineer or architect under a contract for professional services;
the tangible personal property is a scale model provided by an engineer or architect under a contract for professional services;

the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service is a master audio recording provided under a contract with a recording studio for the use of the recording studio's facilities and professional services;
the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service is a master recording, intended for general distribution, of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a motion picture production,
a television production,
a radio production, or
a training video or film

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provided under a contract with a producer for professional services;
the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service is an original graphic design provided by a graphic designer under a contract for professional services;
the tangible personal property, software or telecommunication service is the original design of advertising material provided under a contract for professional services.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Soda beverages

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "soda beverage" in section 1 of the Act, a frozen beverage having the following characteristics is prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the beverage has a gas added to it, whether or not the added gas causes the beverage to be effervescent;
the beverage contains sugar, another natural sweetener or an artificial sweetener.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "soda beverage" in section 1 of the Act, a beverage having the following characteristics is prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the beverage contains both

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a beverage described in paragraph (a) of the definition of "soda beverage" in section 1 of the Act or prescribed under subsection (1) of this section, and
a frozen dessert product, fruit or fruit flavouring, or candy, chocolate or other type of confection;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the beverage does not contain

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: liquor, or
dealcoholized beer, sparkling wine or cider, if the beverage contains 1% or less alcohol by volume.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purchase price if accommodation purchased with meals and other services
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 19 (3) of the Act, the amount attributed to the purchase of accommodation is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if accommodation is also offered by the seller, or the person from whom the accommodation is acquired, without meals or other services, the purchase price at which accommodation without meals or other services is offered;
if paragraph (a) does not apply, the lesser of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 15% of the amount equal to the total value of the consideration accepted by the seller, or the person from whom the accommodation is acquired, including, without limitation, a price in money and the value of services accepted by that seller or person, as the price or on account of the price of the accommodation, meals and other services, and
$100 per day.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purchase price of legal services — excluded fees and charges
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 20 (2) (a) [original purchase price of legal services] of the Act, fees and charges for the transmission, printing or copying of documents are prescribed as excluded if the amount of the fees or charges is reasonably related to the cost of the transmission, printing or copying of documents incurred by the person providing the legal services.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Depreciated purchase price of tangible personal property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, partial year, in relation to tangible personal property, means a period that is less than a year and in which the tangible personal property was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act.
For the purposes of section 25 of the Act, the following tangible personal property is prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: aircraft;
railway rolling stock;
vehicles;
vessels;
equipment;
furnishings;
affixed machinery.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 25 (2) (a) of the Act, the depreciated value of tangible personal property prescribed under subsection (2) of this section is the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: depreciated value = purchase price − [purchase price × rate]
the purchase price of the tangible personal property under section 9 (a) to (d.2) of the Act;
the rate of depreciation determined as follows:
in relation to aircraft, the total of

(i) 25% for each year that the aircraft was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act, and
(ii) 2.0833% for each 30-day period in a partial year that the aircraft was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act;
in relation to railway rolling stock or equipment mounted on railway rolling stock, the total of

(i) 10% for each year that the railway rolling stock or equipment was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act, and
(ii) 0.8333% for each 30-day period in a partial year that the railway rolling stock or equipment was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act;
in relation to a vehicle or equipment mounted on a vehicle, the total of

(i) 30% for each year that the vehicle or equipment was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act, and
(ii) 2.5% for each 30-day period in a partial year that the vehicle or equipment was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act;
in relation to a vessel or equipment mounted on a vessel, the total of

(i) 15% for each year that the vessel or equipment was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act, and
(ii) 1.25% for each 30-day period in a partial year that the vessel or equipment was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act;
in relation to equipment, furnishings or affixed machinery not described in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d), the total of

(i) 20% for each year that the equipment, furnishings or affixed machinery was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act, and
(ii) 1.667% for each 30-day period in a partial year that the equipment, furnishings or affixed machinery was used by the person liable to pay tax under the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3), depreciation must be determined separately for each item of equipment mounted on railway rolling stock, a vehicle or a vessel.

For the purposes of subsection (3), the use of tangible personal property by the person referred to in that subsection must be computed to the nearest 30-day period, with at least 15 days of use counted as one 30-day period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purchase price of software if bundled purchase — prescribed programs
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 26 (4.1) (b) (i) of the Act, the following programs are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an educational program provided by a qualifying school, as defined in the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, or another educational institution;
a training or instructional program designed to develop or improve the knowledge, skills or abilities needed by individuals for a particular trade, occupation or profession.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Purchase price of accommodation if
bundled purchase with meals
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 26 (6) of the Act, the amount attributed to the purchase of accommodation is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if accommodation without meals is also offered by the seller or the person from whom the accommodation is acquired, the purchase price at which accommodation without meals is offered;

subject to paragraph (a) of this section, if accommodation with only one meal per day is also offered by the seller or the person from whom the accommodation is acquired, the purchase price at which the accommodation and one meal is offered;

subject to paragraphs (a) and (b), if accommodation with 2 or more meals per day is also offered by the seller or the person from whom the accommodation is acquired, 60% of the purchase price at which the accommodation and meals are offered.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: When director may enter into agreement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the director may enter into an agreement referred to in section 32 of the Act with a person if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has, over the preceding 3-year period, a history of compliance with the tax payment, collection and remittance requirements of the Act that is satisfactory to the director,
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 96/2013, s. 12 (4).]
the person maintains accounting and inventory management systems that the director is satisfied would ensure accurate remittance of tax in accordance with the agreement,
the person is a registrant, and
the person submits to the director

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an application in a form specified by the director, and
any information required by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may enter into an agreement referred to in section 32 of the Act with a person if, in addition to the circumstances established under subsection (1) of this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person owns or operates a commercial rail service that offers interprovincial or international rail transportation of passengers or goods to members of the public for a fee, or
the person has, in the previous 3 calendar years,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brought or sent into British Columbia, received delivery of in British Columbia, purchased or leased an average per calendar year of not less than $250 000 worth of machinery, equipment or software eligible for an exemption from tax under Part 5 [Production Machinery and Equipment] of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, and received an exemption under that Part of that regulation on an average per calendar year of at least $125 000 worth of that machinery, equipment or software,

brought or sent into British Columbia, received delivery of in British Columbia or purchased an average per calendar year of not less than $250 000 worth of tangible personal property stored in inventory for later use either inside or outside British Columbia and received a refund of tax under section 158 [property shipped out of British Columbia] or 158.1 [property used to improve real property situated outside British Columbia] of the Act on an average per calendar year of at least $125 000 worth of that property, or
both

bcl:clause.bcl:text: brought or sent into British Columbia, received delivery of in British Columbia, purchased or leased machinery, equipment or software referred to in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph and brought or sent into British Columbia, received delivery of in British Columbia or purchased tangible personal property referred to in subparagraph (ii) worth a total on an average per calendar year of at least $250 000, and

received an exemption referred to in subparagraph (i) and a refund referred to in subparagraph (ii) in relation to an average per calendar year of at least $125 000 worth of machinery, equipment and software or tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 96/2013, s. 12 (5).]
Subsection (1) (b) is repealed on April 1, 2016.
Subsection (3) is repealed on January 1, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Requirements when making purchases
that are subject to agreement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director enters into an agreement with a person under section 32 of the Act, the director must issue an agreement number to the person.

For the purposes of section 32 (3) (a) of the Act, a person who has entered into an agreement with the director under section 32 of the Act must pay tax to a collector if the person does not provide to the collector, at or before the time the tax is payable, the agreement number issued to that person under subsection (1) of this section.

For the purposes of section 32 (6) of the Act, a collector is relieved of the obligation to levy and collect tax if the collector, at or before the time the tax is payable, obtains from a person who alleges that the person has entered into an agreement under section 32 of the Act the agreement number issued to that person under subsection (1) of this section.
If a collector obtains a person's agreement number in accordance with subsection (3), the collector must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide the person with a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to the sale or lease unless the collector has entered into a written agreement with the person, and
record the agreement number on the receipt, bill, invoice or agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector who does not collect tax from a person who claims, but is not entitled to, a benefit under an agreement entered into under section 32 of the Act is exempt from the application of section 203 (1) [failure to levy tax] of the Act if the collector has complied with subsection (4) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for payment of tax under agreement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 32 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date in relation to tangible personal property or software is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the earlier of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the last day of the month after the end of the person's reporting period in which the tangible personal property or software is used other than the use of storing, keeping or retaining the tangible personal property or software for any purpose, and

the last day of the month after the end of the person's reporting period that includes the month that is the number of months specified in subsection (3) after the month in which the tangible personal property is brought or sent into British Columbia, delivered in British Columbia, purchased or leased or the software is purchased, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, the earlier of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 30 days after the last day of the person's reporting period in which the tangible personal property or software is used other than the use of storing, keeping or retaining the tangible personal property or software for any purpose, and

30 days after the last day of the person's reporting period that includes the last day of the month that is the number of months specified in subsection (3) after the month in which the tangible personal property is brought or sent into British Columbia, delivered in British Columbia, purchased or leased or the software is purchased.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 32 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date in relation to an eligible taxable service is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the earlier of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the last day of the month after the end of the person's reporting period in which the tangible personal property in relation to which the eligible taxable service is provided is used after the service is provided, other than the use of storing, keeping or retaining the tangible personal property for any purpose, and

the last day of the month after the end of the person's reporting period that includes the month that is the number of months specified in subsection (3) after the month in which the eligible taxable service is purchased, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, the earlier of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 30 days after the last day of the person's reporting period in which the tangible personal property in relation to which the eligible taxable service is provided is used after the service is provided, other than the use of storing, keeping or retaining the tangible personal property for any purpose, and

30 days after the last day of the person's reporting period that includes the last day of the month that is the number of months specified in subsection (3) after the month in which the eligible taxable service is purchased.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsections (1) (a) (ii) and (b) (ii) and (2) (a) (ii) and (b) (ii), the following number of months is specified:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a person described in section 12 (2) (a) [interprovincial or international commercial rail transportation], 24 months;
in the case of any other person, 12 months.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 65 [estimate of hours or distance conveyance will travel] of the Act applies in relation to tax that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: imposed under sections 60 (2), 62 (3), 63 (3) and 64 (2) of the Act, and
required under section 32 (5) of the Act to be paid by a date specified in subsection (1) or (2) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 66 [adjustment of tax] of the Act applies in relation to an estimate made under section 65 of the Act as applied by subsection (4) of this section and, for that purpose, tax payable under section 66 (2) of the Act must be paid as required by section 66 (3) and (3.1) unless the agreement under section 32 (1) of the Act specifies a different date, in which case the tax must be paid on or before the date specified in the agreement.

bcl:part.bcl:text:
Taxes in Relation to
Tangible Personal Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Document requirements for section 30 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 30 (7) (b) [when tax is payable in respect of vehicles] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tax has been levied in accordance with section 179 [collection and remittance of tax by collector] of the Act in respect of a vehicle, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia is required to obtain a receipt, bill, invoice or other document that shows the tax as a separate item on the document.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Calculation and payment of tax in respect of vehicles used
in petroleum or natural gas exploration or development

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, month has the same meaning as in the Interpretation Act.

For the purposes of section 51 (9) (a) of the Act, the amount of tax payable under section 51 (3) of the Act in relation to tangible personal property is equal to 1/36th of the tax that would, but for section 51 of the Act, be payable under section 49 of the Act by the person to whom section 51 of the Act applies in relation to the tangible personal property.
For the purposes of section 51 (9) (b) of the Act, the prescribed period is a month.

For the purposes of section 51 (9) (c) of the Act, the prescribed date for the payment of tax under section 51 (3) of the Act by a person who is not a registrant is the last day of the calendar month after the month in which the property is used in British Columbia.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed number of days for section 53 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 53 [exemption if less than minimum threshold use in British Columbia] of the Act, the prescribed number of days is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 41 days for barge-mounted cranes that have a lifting capacity of greater than 100 metric tonnes if those cranes are relieved, under the Vessel Duties Reduction or Removal Regulations (Canada), SOR/90-304, from customs duties, or
6 days for all other tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Non-taxable imported goods prescribed for section 54 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 54 (2) (e) [application of this Division] of the Act, tangible personal property that is not subject to tax under Division III of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act because the tangible personal property is a good included in section 7.01 of Schedule VII of that Act is prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed parts for Division 6 of Part 3 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) (i) of the description of "BC usage" in sections 60 (2), 63 (3) and 64 (2) of the Act, the following parts are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an aircraft engine;
an aircraft airframe.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed jurisdictions for section 70 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 70 (2) [when tax under section 69 must be paid] of the Act, those jurisdictions that are member jurisdictions of the International Registration Plan are prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Travel ratio

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: calculation year means the period beginning on July 1 and ending on the following June 30;
non-participating fleet means a fleet of vehicles licensed under licences to which a prorating agreement applies, which fleet is not a participating fleet;
participating fleet means a fleet of vehicles that includes a vehicle that, during the previous calculation year of the fleet and while part of that fleet,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: was a vehicle licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applied, and
travelled in a prescribed jurisdiction;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: prescribed jurisdiction means a jurisdiction prescribed under section 19;
previous calculation year, in relation to a vehicle in a fleet or a fleet of vehicles, means the most recent calculation year that ended before the fleet licensing date of the fleet;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to British Columbia, means the calendar year before the current calendar year, and

in relation to another prescribed jurisdiction, means the most recently completed period of 12 consecutive calendar months beginning on the date determined, in accordance with a prorating agreement, by that jurisdiction for the purpose of apportioning recurring fees and taxes in accordance with the prorating agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who, on or before the fleet licensing date of a participating fleet, is licensing in British Columbia a vehicle in the fleet must report to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia the total distance the vehicles in the fleet travelled in each prescribed jurisdiction in the period

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: beginning on the first date in the previous calculation year of the fleet on which a vehicle in the fleet was licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applied, or the first day of that calculation year, whichever is later, and
ending on the last day of that calculation year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of the calculation of tax payable under section 69 (2) [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed] of the Act in respect of a vehicle that a person licenses in a prescribed jurisdiction as part of a non-participating fleet, the travel ratio is the ratio of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the total distances travelled in British Columbia in the previous calculation year of each vehicle by all vehicles licensed in the prescribed jurisdiction under a licence to which a prorating agreement applied, as reported to that prescribed jurisdiction in the reporting year of that jurisdiction,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the sum of the total distances travelled in all prescribed jurisdictions in the previous calculation year of each vehicle by all vehicles licensed in that prescribed jurisdiction under a licence to which a prorating agreement applied, as reported to that prescribed jurisdiction in the reporting year of that jurisdiction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of the calculation of tax payable under section 69 (2) of the Act in respect of a vehicle that a person licenses in a prescribed jurisdiction as part of a participating fleet, the travel ratio is the ratio of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the distance travelled in British Columbia by the vehicles in the fleet in the period

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: beginning on the first date in the previous calculation year of the fleet on which a vehicle in the fleet was licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applied, or the first day of that calculation year, whichever is later, and
ending on the last day of that calculation year,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the distance travelled in all prescribed jurisdictions by the vehicles in that fleet in the same period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for section 80.3 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.3 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the tax is payable by a person who is not a registrant and the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law before the contractor obtains a refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property, the last day of the month after the month in which the contractor obtained the refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property;

if the tax is payable by a person who is not a registrant and the tangible personal property is not used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law before the contractor obtains a refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property, the last day of the month after the month in which the tangible personal property is used in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law;

if the tax is payable by a registrant, the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months and the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law before the contractor obtains a refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the contractor obtained the refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property;

if the tax is payable by a registrant, the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months and the tangible personal property is not used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law before the contractor obtains a refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is used in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law;

if the tax is payable by a registrant, the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months and the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law before the contractor obtains a refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the contractor obtained the refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property;

if the tax is payable by a registrant, the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months and the tangible personal property is not used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law before the contractor obtains a refund under section 80.2 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is used in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions for section 82.1 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82.1 (1) (a) [tax on parts or material if property containing parts or material used for new purpose] of the Act, the following provisions of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 40 (3) [printers and publishers];

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82.2 (1) (a) [tax if conditions for exemption not maintained for specified period] of the Act, the following provisions of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation are prescribed:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for section 102 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 102 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date for the payment of tax under section 102 (1) or (2) of the Act is the following applicable date:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the tax is payable by a person who is not a registrant, the last day of the month after the month in which the person enters into the agreement;

if the tax is payable by a registrant and the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the person enters into the agreement;

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions for section 103 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 103 (3) (d) of the Act, the following provisions of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation are prescribed:

bcl:division.bcl:text:
Change in Use of Motor Vehicle
by Dealer or Manufacturer

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Interpretation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: dealer has the same meaning as in section 84.1 of the Act;
dealer-use vehicle, in relation to a dealer, means a motor vehicle that is readily available for sale or lease by the dealer;
donated vehicle means a motor vehicle that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is readily available for sale or lease, except while being provided to organizers or participants referred to in paragraph (b),
is provided by the manufacturer or dealer, at the manufacturer or dealer's own expense, to organizers of or participants in a community event,
is returned to the manufacturer or dealer at the conclusion of the event, and
is, on return under paragraph (c), either returned to the sale or lease inventory of the manufacturer or dealer, or sold by the manufacturer or dealer;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: manufacturer has the same meaning as in section 84.1 of the Act;

parts delivery or shuttle vehicle, in relation to a dealer, means a motor vehicle that is readily available for sale or lease by the dealer and is used by the dealer to transport motor vehicle parts or the dealer's customers;
used zero-emission vehicle has the same meaning as in section 55 (1) [exemptions in relation to transportation] of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "dealer-use vehicle" in subsection (1), a vehicle is not readily available for sale or lease if the vehicle

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is dedicated to a specific use, including, without limitation, a vehicle used for racing or as a tow truck, or
is not usually left on the business premises of the dealer during normal business hours.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "donated vehicle" in subsection (1), a vehicle is not readily available for sale or lease if the vehicle is not usually left on the business premises of the manufacturer or dealer during normal business hours when the vehicle is not being used during a community event.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Change in use of motor vehicle by dealer

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, business vehicle, in relation to a dealer for a month, means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a dealer-use vehicle that is used in the month only for a use prescribed under subsection (3) (a) (iii);
a donated vehicle that is used in the month only for a use prescribed under subsection (3) (b);
a parts delivery or shuttle vehicle that is used in the month only for a use prescribed under subsection (3) (c).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following motor vehicles are prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (2) and (3) of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a dealer-use vehicle;
a donated vehicle;
a parts delivery or shuttle vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following uses of a motor vehicle prescribed under subsection (2) are prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (2) and (3) of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a dealer-use vehicle, use in one or more of the following ways:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by a dealer, or by an officer, salesperson or employee of the dealer, for any purpose related to the dealer's business as a motor dealer;
by a dealer, or by an officer, salesperson or employee of the dealer, for personal transportation;
as a courtesy car;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a donated vehicle, use by the organizers of or participants in a community event solely for use during the event;
in relation to a parts delivery or shuttle vehicle, use only in one or both of the following ways:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by a dealer, or by an officer, salesperson or employee of the dealer, to transport motor vehicle parts in the course of the dealer's business;
by a dealer, or by an officer, salesperson or employee of the dealer, to transport the dealer's customers while the customers' vehicles are being serviced in the course of the dealer's business.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84.1 (2) and (3) of the Act, the amount of tax payable by a dealer in respect of the dealer-use vehicles, other than zero-emission vehicles, that are used in a month only for a use prescribed under subsection (3) (a) (i) or (ii) of this section is equal to the amount calculated by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax payable = 1.75% (average vehicle value × users × applicable percentage)
the dealer's average vehicle value for the month as determined under subsection (5);
the number of the dealer's employees authorized to use dealer-use vehicles, other than courtesy cars and zero-emission vehicles, during that month;
7%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is less than $55 000;
8%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (4), a dealer's average vehicle value for a month is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total of the following applicable amounts in respect of each vehicle, other than zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month is in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer-use vehicles are held:
the total consideration paid for the vehicle by the dealer;
the costs and expenses described in section 10 (2) (f) of the Act and incurred by the dealer in respect of the vehicle;
the dealer's costs in manufacturing the vehicle;

if tax is payable under section 84.1 (3) of the Act, the total consideration paid by the dealer for the tangible personal property that is exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) of the Act and that has been processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into the vehicle;

the total number of vehicles, other than zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month are in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer-use vehicles are held.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84.1 (2) and (3) of the Act, the amount of tax payable by a dealer in respect of vehicles that, in a month, are business vehicles of the dealer, other than zero-emission vehicles, is equal to the amount calculated by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax payable = 1.75% (average vehicle value × number of vehicles × applicable percentage)
the dealer's average vehicle value for the month as determined under subsection (7);
the number of vehicles used by the dealer as business vehicles, other than zero-emission vehicles, during that month;
7%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is less than $55 000;
8%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20%, if the dealer's average vehicle value for the month is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (6), a dealer's average vehicle value, not including zero-emission vehicles, for a month is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total of the following applicable amounts in respect of each vehicle, other than zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month is in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer's business vehicles are held:
the total consideration paid for the vehicle by the dealer;
the costs and expenses described in section 10 (2) (f) of the Act and incurred by the dealer in respect of the vehicle;
the dealer's costs in manufacturing the vehicle;

if tax is payable under section 84.1 (3) of the Act, the total consideration paid by the dealer for the tangible personal property that is exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) of the Act and that has been processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into the vehicle;

the total number of vehicles, other than zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month are in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer's business vehicles are held.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84.1 (2) and (3) of the Act, the amount of tax payable by a dealer in respect of the dealer-use vehicles that are zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, and that are used in a month only for a use prescribed under subsection (3) (a) (i) or (ii) of this section is equal to the amount calculated by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax payable = 1.75% (average ZEV value × users × applicable percentage)
the dealer's average zero-emission vehicle value for the month as determined under subsection (9);
the number of the dealer's employees authorized to use dealer-use vehicles that are zero-emission vehicles, other than courtesy cars and used zero-emission vehicles, during that month;
7%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is less than $75 000;
8%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (8), a dealer's average ZEV value for a month is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total of the following applicable amounts in respect of each zero-emission vehicle, other than a used zero-emission vehicle, that at the end of the month is in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer-use vehicles are held:
the total consideration paid for the zero-emission vehicle by the dealer;
the costs and expenses described in section 10 (2) (f) of the Act and incurred by the dealer in respect of the zero-emission vehicle;
the dealer's costs in manufacturing the zero-emission vehicle;

if tax is payable under section 84.1 (3) of the Act, the total consideration paid by the dealer for the tangible personal property that is exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) of the Act and that has been processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into the zero-emission vehicle;

the total number of zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month are in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer-use vehicles are held.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84.1 (2) and (3) of the Act, the amount of tax payable by a dealer in respect of zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, that, in a month, are business vehicles of the dealer is equal to the amount calculated by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax payable = 1.75% (average ZEV value × number of ZEV × applicable percentage)
the dealer's average zero-emission vehicle value for the month as determined under subsection (11);
the number of zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, used by the dealer as business vehicles during that month;
7%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is less than $75 000;
8%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20%, if the dealer's average ZEV value for the month is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (10), a dealer's average ZEV value for a month is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total of the following applicable amounts in respect of each zero-emission vehicle, other than a used zero-emission vehicle, that at the end of the month is in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer's business vehicles are held:
the total consideration paid for the zero-emission vehicle by the dealer;
the costs and expenses described in section 10 (2) (f) of the Act and incurred by the dealer in respect of the zero-emission vehicle;
the dealer's costs in manufacturing the zero-emission vehicle;

if tax is payable under section 84.1 (3) of the Act, the total consideration paid by the dealer for the tangible personal property that is exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) of the Act and that has been processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into the zero-emission vehicle;

the total number of zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month are in the dealer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the dealer's business vehicles are held.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Change in use of motor vehicle by manufacturer

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Donated vehicles are prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (4) and (5) of the Act.

In relation to a donated vehicle prescribed under subsection (1), use of the vehicle by the organizers of or participants in a community event solely for use during the event is prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (4) and (5) of the Act.

For the purposes of section 84.1 (4) and (5) of the Act, the amount of tax payable by a manufacturer in respect of a donated vehicle that is not a zero-emission vehicle used for a use prescribed under subsection (2) of this section is equal to the amount calculated by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax payable = 1.75% (average vehicle cost × number of vehicles × applicable percentage)
the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month as determined under subsection (4);
the number of vehicles used as donated vehicles that are not zero-emission vehicles during that month;
7%, if the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month is less than $55 000;
8%, if the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9%, if the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10%, if the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15%, if the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20%, if the manufacturer's average vehicle cost for the month is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3), a manufacturer's average vehicle cost in respect of vehicles that are not zero-emission vehicles for a month is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total of the following applicable amounts in respect of each vehicle that is not a zero-emission vehicle that at the end of the month is in the manufacturer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the donated vehicles are held or, if the manufacturer does not have a sale or lease inventory for British Columbia, in respect of all of the manufacturer's donated vehicles, that are not zero-emission vehicles, that are in British Columbia at the end of the month:
the costs and expenses described in section 10 (2) (f) of the Act and incurred by the manufacturer in respect of the vehicle;
the manufacturer's costs in manufacturing the vehicle;

if tax is payable under section 84.1 (5) of the Act, the total consideration paid by the manufacturer for the tangible personal property that is exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) of the Act and that has been processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into the vehicle;

the total number of vehicles, that are not zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month are in the manufacturer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the donated vehicles are held;

if the manufacturer does not have a sale or lease inventory for British Columbia, the total number of the manufacturer's donated vehicles that are not zero-emission vehicles and that are in British Columbia at the end of the month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84.1 (4) and (5) of the Act, the amount of tax payable by a manufacturer in respect of a donated vehicle, that is a zero-emission vehicle, other than a used zero-emission vehicle, used for a use prescribed under subsection (2) of this section is equal to the amount calculated by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax payable = 1.75% (average ZEV cost × number of ZEV × applicable percentage)
the manufacturer's average zero-emission vehicle cost for the month as determined under subsection (6);
the number of zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, used as donated vehicles during that month;
7%, if the manufacturer's average ZEV cost for the month is less than $75 000;
8%, if the manufacturer's average ZEV cost for the month is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9%, if the manufacturer's average ZEV cost for the month is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10%, if the manufacturer's average ZEV cost for the month is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15%, if the manufacturer's average ZEV cost for the month is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20%, if the manufacturer's average ZEV cost for the month is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (5), a manufacturer's average ZEV cost for a month is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total of the following applicable amounts in respect of each zero-emission vehicle, other than a used zero-emission vehicle, that at the end of the month is in the manufacturer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the donated vehicles are held or, if the manufacturer does not have a sale or lease inventory for British Columbia, in respect of all of the manufacturer's donated vehicles that are zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, and are in British Columbia at the end of the month:
the costs and expenses described in section 10 (2) (f) of the Act and incurred by the manufacturer in respect of the zero-emission vehicle;
the manufacturer's costs in manufacturing the zero-emission vehicle;

if tax is payable under section 84.1 (5) of the Act, the total consideration paid by the manufacturer for the tangible personal property that is exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) of the Act and that has been processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into the zero-emission vehicle;

the total number of zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, that at the end of the month are in the manufacturer's sale or lease inventory for British Columbia in which the donated vehicles are held;

if the manufacturer does not have a sale or lease inventory for British Columbia, the total number of the manufacturer's donated vehicles that are zero-emission vehicles, other than used zero-emission vehicles, and are in British Columbia at the end of the month.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for section 84.1 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84.1 (6) of the Act, the prescribed date is the following applicable date:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the dealer or manufacturer is a registrant and the dealer or manufacturer's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the dealer or manufacturer's reporting period in which the motor vehicle is used for the use prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (2), (3), (4) or (5) of the Act;

if the dealer or manufacturer is a registrant and the dealer or manufacturer's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day in the dealer or manufacturer's reporting period in which the motor vehicle is used for the use prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (2), (3), (4) or (5) of the Act;
in any other case, the last day of the month after the month in which the motor vehicle is used for the use prescribed for the purposes of section 84.1 (2), (3), (4) or (5) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed period for section 107 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the descriptions of "BC usage" and "total usage" in section 107 (2) of the Act, the prescribed period is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the software is software referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition of "software" in section 1 of the Act and the purchaser is referred to in section 107 (1) (b) (i) of the Act, 3 years beginning on the date the purchaser purchased the software,

if the software is software referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition of "software" in section 1 of the Act and the purchaser is referred to in section 107 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act, 3 years beginning on the date the purchaser first uses the software or allows the software to be used on or with an electronic device ordinarily situated in British Columbia, or
if the software is software referred to in paragraph (b) or (c) of the definition of "software" in section 1 of the Act, the shortest of the following periods:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the term of the applicable right referred to in paragraph (b) or (c) of that definition;
if the purchaser is referred to in section 107 (1) (b) (i) of the Act, 3 years beginning on the date the purchaser purchased the software;

if the purchaser is referred to in section 107 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act, 3 years beginning on the date the purchaser first uses the software or allows the software to be used on or with an electronic device ordinarily situated in British Columbia.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions for section 109.1 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 109.1 (1) (a) [tax if conditions of exemption for software not maintained for specified period] of the Act, the following provisions of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 153 [software transferred between related corporations];
section 154 [software transferred to new corporation — wholly owned and controlled];
section 155 [software transferred to new corporation — not wholly owned and controlled].

bcl:part.bcl:text: Prescribed Dates for Payment of Tax by Registrants

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 29 of Act — when tax is payable if tax not otherwise collected

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 29 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the tax would otherwise be payable under section 28 [when tax is payable in respect of a purchase or lease] of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the tax would otherwise be payable under section 28 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), for the purposes of section 29 (4) of the Act in relation to tax imposed under section 49 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use], 52 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia by non-residents], 93 [tax if energy product brought into British Columbia for use] or 101 (2) [tax on reusable containers] of the Act, the prescribed date is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period that includes the entry date of the tangible personal property, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period that includes the entry date of the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 30.1 of Act — when tax is payable in respect of promotional material
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 30.1 (3) (b) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant provides, by way of promotional distribution, the promotional material to another person, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant provides, by way of promotional distribution, the promotional material to another person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 30 of Act — when tax is payable in respect of vehicles
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 30 (1.1) (c) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of section 37 of the Act, in which the vehicle is purchased at a sale in British Columbia,
in the case of section 49 or 52 of the Act, that includes the entry date of the vehicle, or
in the case of section 100 (1) of the Act, in which the registrant receives the gift of the vehicle, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of section 37 of the Act, in which the vehicle is purchased at a sale in British Columbia,
in the case of section 49 or 52 of the Act, that includes the entry date of the vehicle, or
in the case of section 100 (1) of the Act, in which the registrant receives the gift of the vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 31 of Act — when tax is payable
in respect of gifts of boats or aircraft
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 31 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant receives the gift of the boat or aircraft, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant receives the gift of the boat or aircraft.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 41 of Act — tax if leased property used in British Columbia during rental period
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 41 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the rental period ends, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the rental period ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 42 of Act — tax if balance of lease price
becomes due on breach of lease
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 42 (2.1) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the payment referred to in section 42 (1) (b) of the Act becomes due under the terms of the lease, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the payment referred to in section 42 (1) (b) of the Act becomes due under the terms of the lease.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 51 of Act — tax if tangible personal property
brought into British Columbia for temporary use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 51 (10) of the Act, the prescribed date for the payment of tax under section 51 (3) of the Act by a registrant in relation to tangible personal property to which section 51 (9) of the Act does not apply is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is first used in British Columbia during the calculation year in respect of which tax is payable, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is first used in British Columbia during the calculation year in respect of which tax is payable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 51 (10) of the Act, the prescribed date for the payment of tax under section 51 (3) of the Act by a registrant in relation to tangible personal property to which section 51 (9) of the Act applies is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is used in British Columbia, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is used in British Columbia.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 51.1 of Act — tax if tangible personal property
no longer for temporary use
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 51.1 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, for a purpose other than for temporary use, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, for a purpose other than for temporary use.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 60 of Act — tax if conveyance purchased in
British Columbia for interjurisdictional use
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 60 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant purchased the conveyance or the part for a conveyance, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant purchased the conveyance or the part for a conveyance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Sections 61, 61.1 and 62 of Act — lease of conveyance
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 61 (6) [tax if sale and lease-back of conveyance], 61.1 (8) [tax if sale and lease-back of conveyance for which tax paid under former Act] and 62 (6) [tax if leased conveyance used in British Columbia] of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the rental period ends, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the rental period ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 63 of Act — tax if conveyance brought into
and used in British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 63 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period that includes the entry date of the taxable conveyance, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period that includes the entry date of the taxable conveyance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 64 of Act — tax if change in use of
conveyance acquired for resale
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 64 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the taxable conveyance, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the taxable conveyance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 66 of Act — adjustment of tax
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 66 (3.1) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the relevant period ends, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the relevant period ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 80.4 of Act — tax if change in use of tangible
personal property used to improve real property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.4 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 80.4 (1) (c) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 80.4 (1) (c) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 80.5 of Act — transitional tax on tangible personal
property used by contractor to improve real property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.5 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant uses the tangible personal property in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant uses the tangible personal property in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 80.7 of Act — transitional tax on tangible personal
property incorporated into property subject to tax under
New Housing Transition Tax and Rebate Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.7 (7) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is incorporated into the property referred to in section 80.7 (2) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is incorporated into the property referred to in section 80.7 (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 80.8 of Act — transitional tax on mobile homes
affixed to land situated in British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.8 (6) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the mobile home is affixed to land as referred to in section 80.8 (2) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the mobile home is affixed to land as referred to in section 80.8 (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 81 of Act — tax if change in use of property
acquired for resale
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 81 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,
