if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 82 of Act — tax if property used for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 82.01 of Act — tax if leased property used for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82.01 (7) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82.01 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82.01 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 82.1 of Act — tax on parts or material if property
containing parts or material used for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82.1 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82.1 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82.1 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 82.2 of Act — tax if conditions for exemption
not maintained for specified period
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82.2 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the conditions referred to in section 82.2 (1) of the Act are not maintained, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the conditions referred to in section 82.2 (1) of the Act are not maintained.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 82.3 of Act — tax if change in use of vehicle, boat or aircraft
exempt from tax under Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 82.3 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82.3 (2) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 82.3 (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 83 of Act — tax if change in use of property acquired for lease
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 83 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first ceases to capitalize the property as lease inventory in the registrant's business accounting records, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first ceases to capitalize the property as lease inventory in the registrant's business accounting records.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 84 of Act — tax if change in use of resulting
tangible personal property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 84 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the tangible personal property first mentioned in section 84 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the tangible personal property first mentioned in section 84 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 85 of Act — tax if change in use of prototype
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 85 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the earliest of the following occurs:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the registrant first becomes a user of the prototype or copy of the prototype;
the consideration for use of the prototype or copy of the prototype is paid;
the consideration for use of the prototype or copy of the prototype becomes due, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the earliest of the following occurs:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the registrant first becomes a user of the prototype or copy of the prototype;
the consideration for use of the prototype or copy of the prototype is paid;
the consideration for use of the prototype or copy of the prototype becomes due.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 87 of Act — tax if recording exhibited
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 87 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the motion picture is exhibited, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the motion picture is exhibited.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 88 of Act — tax if leased tangible personal property becomes part of real property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 88 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 106 of Act — tax on use of software on device
in British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 106 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the software is first used as referred to in section 106 (1) (a) or (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the software is first used as referred to in section 106 (1) (a) or (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 107 of Act — tax on business use of software
on devices in and outside British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 107 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if section 107 (1) (b) (i) of the Act applies to the registrant in relation to the software and the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the software is purchased,

if section 107 (1) (b) (i) of the Act applies to the registrant in relation to the software and the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the software is purchased,

if section 107 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act applies to the registrant in relation to the software and the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses that software or allows that software to be used as referred to in section 107 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act, or

if section 107 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act applies to the registrant in relation to the software and the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses that software or allows that software to be used as referred to in section 107 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 108 of Act — adjustment of tax under section 107 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 108 (4.1) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the BC usage ends, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the BC usage ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 109 of Act — tax if use of software changes
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 109 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the software, or allows the software to be used, as referred to in section 109 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the software, or allows the software to be used, as referred to in section 109 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 109.1 of Act — tax if conditions of exemption
for software not maintained for specified period
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 109.1 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the conditions referred to in section 109.1 (1) of the Act are not maintained, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the conditions referred to in section 109.1 (1) of the Act are not maintained.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 110 of Act — tax if change in use of resulting
software or tangible personal property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 110 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a user of the software first referred to in section 110 (1) (b) of the Act, or
a user of the tangible personal property referred to in section 110 (1) (b) of the Act, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a user of the software first referred to in section 110 (1) (b) of the Act, or
a user of the tangible personal property referred to in section 110 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 117.1 of Act — tax if resulting property
used for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 117.1 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the resulting tangible personal property, or allows the resulting tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 117.1 (2) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the resulting tangible personal property, or allows the resulting tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in section 117.1 (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 120 of Act — tax if related service provided
outside British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 120 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant subsequently brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant subsequently brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 120.1 of Act — tax if change in use of related service
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 120.1 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant subsequently uses the related service, or allows the related service to be used, as referred to in section 120.1 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant subsequently uses the related service, or allows the related service to be used, as referred to in section 120.1 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 123.2 of Act — tax if change in use of
accommodation purchased for resale

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the accommodation, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first becomes a user of the accommodation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 123.3 of Act — tax if accommodation used
for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 123.3 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the accommodation, or allows the accommodation to be used, as referred to in section 123.3 (1) (b) or (2) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the accommodation, or allows the accommodation to be used, as referred to in section 123.3 (1) (b) or (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 130.1 of Act — tax on telecommunication service
purchased substantially for resale
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 130.1 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the telecommunication service is purchased, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the telecommunication service is purchased.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 130.2 of Act — additional tax on telecommunication
service purchased substantially for resale
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 130.2 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period that includes the month referred to in section 130.2 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period that includes the end of the month referred to in section 130.2 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 130.3 of Act — tax on telecommunication service
if no longer substantially for resale
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 130.3 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period that includes the month referred to in section 130.3 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period that includes the end of the month referred to in section 130.3 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 132.1 of Act — tax if telecommunication service
used for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 132.1 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the telecommunication service, or allows the telecommunication service to be used, as referred to in section 132.1 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the telecommunication service, or allows the telecommunication service to be used, as referred to in section 132.1 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 133 of Act — tax if motion picture exhibited
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 133 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the motion picture is exhibited, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the motion picture is exhibited.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 134.5 of Act — tax if online marketplace service used for new purpose
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 134.5 (3) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the online marketplace service, or allows the online marketplace service to be used, as referred to in section 134.5 (1) (b) of the Act, or

if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the registrant first uses the online marketplace service, or allows the online marketplace service to be used, as referred to in section 134.5 (1) (b) of the Act.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Bulk Transactions and Realization of Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 187 of Act — bulk transactions
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 187 (5) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the bulk transaction occurred, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the bulk transaction occurred.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Section 222 of Act — distribution of proceeds
from realization of property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 222 (6) of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the registrant's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the registrant's reporting period in which the disposition occurred, or
if the registrant's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the registrant's reporting period in which the disposition occurred.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for remitting tax

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 179 (2) [remittance of tax by collector] of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the collector's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the collector's reporting period in which the amount of tax under the Act is levied by the collector, or

if the collector's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the collector's reporting period in which the amount of tax under the Act is levied by the collector.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 179 (3) [remittance of amounts collected] of the Act, the prescribed date is the last day of the month after the month in which the amount referred to in that section is collected.
For the purposes of section 179 (4) [remittance of tax by direct seller] of the Act, the prescribed date is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the direct seller's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the direct seller's reporting period in which the amount of tax under section 99 (4) of the Act is collected by the direct seller, or

if the direct seller's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the direct seller's reporting period in which the amount of tax under section 99 (4) of the Act is collected by the direct seller.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 182.2 (4) [collection of tax on liquor sold by auction] of the Act, the prescribed date is the last day of the month after the month in which the liquor is sold by auction.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed manner for remitting tax

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 179 (2) and (4) of the Act and for the purposes of section 179 (3) of the Act in relation to a collector, the prescribed manner is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person remitting the tax had a total of $1.5 million or more of sales or leases of property or services in Canada in the previous 12 months, by an electronic method specified by the director;
in any other case,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by an electronic method specified by the director,
by a money order or cheque delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director,
by a money order or cheque mailed to the director at an address specified by the director,
by cash delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director, if cash is accepted as a manner of payment at that location, or
by use of a debit card at a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if the use of a debit card is accepted as a manner of payment at that location.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 179 (3) of the Act in relation to a person who is not a collector, the prescribed manner is a manner set out in subsection (1) (b) (i) to (v) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for filing designation and other information
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 179.1 (4) of the Act, the prescribed date is 90 days after the date the sale, provision or lease referred to in section 179.1 (2) (a) is made or entered into.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed manner for remitting tax on liquor sold by auction
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 182.2 (4) of the Act, the prescribed manner is a manner set out in section 73 (1) (b) (i) to (v) of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowance for registrants

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 185 of the Act, the prescribed allowance in respect of a reporting period is the amount set out in column 2 of the following table opposite the amount of tax, set out in column 1 of the table, remitted as required under the Act for the reporting period, other than tax imposed under section 123 or 123.02 of the Act:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: 6.6% of the tax remitted to a maximum of $198

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 185 of the Act, the following conditions and limitations apply in respect of the deduction of an allowance by a registrant:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a registrant may not deduct more than one allowance for a reporting period if the registrant has more than one place of business in British Columbia or remits tax to the government more than once during a reporting period;
if a registrant has been issued more than one registration number, the registrant may deduct an allowance for tax remitted in relation to only one registration number.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Collector's return for each registration number
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a registrant has been issued more than one registration number, the registrant must file a separate collector's return for each registration number.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Collector's return for each designated accommodation area
bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 75, if a collector levies tax imposed under section 123 or 123.02 of the Act, the collector must file separate collector's returns as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for each designated accommodation area in respect of which the collector levies tax under section 123 of the Act, a collector's return that relates only to the tax imposed under that section in that designated accommodation area;

for each designated major event accommodation area in respect of which the collector levies tax under section 123.02 of the Act, a collector's return that relates only to the tax imposed under that section in that designated major event accommodation area;
a collector's return that relates to all other tax under the Act that the collector levies.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for filing collector's return

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 186 (1) [collector's returns] of the Act, the prescribed date for the filing of a collector's return by a collector is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the collector's reporting period is a period of one or more months, the last day of the month after the end of the collector's reporting period, or
if the collector's reporting period is not a period of one or more months, 30 days after the last day of the collector's reporting period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 186 (1) of the Act, the prescribed date for the filing of a collector's return by a person referred to in section 186 (1) (b) or (c) of the Act is the last day of the month after the month in which the amount referred to in section 186 (1) (b) or (c) of the Act is collected.

For the purposes of section 186 (1) of the Act, the prescribed date for the filing of a collector's return by a person referred to in section 186 (1) (d) of the Act is the last day of the month after the month in which the liquor is sold by auction.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed manner for filing collector's return

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 186 (1) of the Act, the prescribed manner for the filing of a collector's return by a collector is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person filing the collector's return had a total of $1.5 million or more of sales or leases of property or services in Canada in the previous 12 months, by an electronic method specified by the director;
in any other case,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by an electronic method specified by the director,
by delivery to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director, or
by mail to the director at an address specified by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 186 (1) of the Act, the prescribed manner for the filing of a collector's return by a person, other than a collector, referred to in section 186 (1) (b), (c) or (d) of the Act is a manner set out in subsection (1) (b) (i) to (iii) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [am. B.C. Reg. 117/2014, Sch. 1, s. 9 and Sch. 3, s. 5.]

bcl:division.bcl:text: Payment of Tax and Filing of Taxpayer Return

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Manner for payment of tax

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) applies to a person if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is not a registrant and any of the following apply:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person must pay tax imposed under a relevant provision, as defined in section 28 of the Act, and the tax is payable in accordance with section 29 (2) (b) or (3) of the Act;
the person must pay tax imposed under section 37, 49, 52 or 100 of the Act in respect of a vehicle and the tax is payable in accordance with section 30 (1.1) (b) of the Act;
the person must pay tax imposed under section 100 of the Act in respect of a gift of a boat or aircraft and the tax is payable in accordance with section 31 (2) (a) of the Act;
the person must pay tax imposed under section 42 of the Act and the tax is payable in accordance with section 42 (2) (b) of the Act;
the person must pay tax imposed under section 37 of the Act and the tax is payable in accordance with section 88 of the Act;
the person must pay tax imposed under any of the sections referred to in section 192 (1) of the Act, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person must pay tax imposed under any of the sections referred to in section 192 (3) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this subsection applies must pay the tax referred to in subsection (0.1) in one of the following manners:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by a money order or cheque delivered to a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director;
by a money order or cheque mailed to the director at an address specified by the director;
by cash delivered to a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if cash is accepted as a manner of payment at that location;
by use of a debit card at a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if the use of a debit card is accepted as a manner of payment at that location.
by an electronic method specified by the director;
by a money order or cheque delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director;
by a money order or cheque mailed to the director at an address specified by the director;
by cash delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director, if cash is accepted as a manner of payment at that location;
by use of a debit card at a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if the use of a debit card is accepted as a manner of payment at that location.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.3 (3), 84.1 (6) and 102 (3) of the Act, if the tax imposed under the section is payable by a registrant, the prescribed manner is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by an electronic method specified by the director;
by a money order or cheque delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director;
by a money order or cheque mailed to the director at an address specified by the director;
by cash delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director, if cash is accepted as a manner of payment at that location;
by use of a debit card at a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if the use of a debit card is accepted as a manner of payment at that location.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 80.3 (3), 84.1 (6) and 102 (3) of the Act, if the tax is payable by a person who is not a registrant, the prescribed manner is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by a money order or cheque delivered to a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director;
by a money order or cheque mailed to the director at an address specified by the director;
by cash delivered to a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if cash is accepted as a manner of payment at that location;
by use of a debit card at a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, if the use of a debit card is accepted as a manner of payment at that location.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date for filing taxpayer return
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 193 (2) of the Act, the prescribed date is the last day of the month in which the tax imposed under the Act must be paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed manner for filing taxpayer return
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 193 (2) of the Act, the prescribed manner is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by delivery to a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director;
by mail to the director at an address specified by the director.

bcl:division.bcl:text: When Payments and Returns Are Received

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amount paid or remitted to government
bcl:section.bcl:text: A payment or remittance of an amount to the government under the Act is deemed not to be paid or remitted to the government until,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the manner of payment or remittance is an electronic method specified by the director, the day of receipt by the government,

if the payment or remittance is delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director, the day recorded as the day of receipt by the Service BC Centre, participating savings institution or government office,
if the payment or remittance is delivered by mail, the day the payment or remittance is mailed, and

if the payment or remittance is made by use of a debit card at a Service BC Centre or a government office specified by the director, the day recorded as the day of receipt by the Service BC Centre or government office.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Return filed with director
bcl:section.bcl:text: A collector's return or a taxpayer return is deemed not to be filed with the director until,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the return is filed by an electronic method specified by the director, the day of receipt by the government,

if the return is delivered to a Service BC Centre, a participating savings institution or a government office specified by the director, the day recorded as the day of receipt by the Service BC Centre, participating savings institution or government office, and
if the return is delivered by mail, the day the return is mailed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Date of postmark deemed date of mailing
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 82 (c) and 83 (c), a payment, remittance or return is deemed to be mailed on the date of the postmark on the payment, remittance or return.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirement to provide receipt, bill or invoice

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector must provide a person with a receipt, bill or invoice if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the collector

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: sells or provides tangible personal property, software or a taxable service to the person at a retail sale in British Columbia,
causes tangible personal property to be delivered into British Columbia to the person, or
leases, as lessor, tangible personal property to the person, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person requests a receipt, bill or invoice.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than a collector, who sells liquor by auction must provide the purchaser with a receipt, bill or invoice if requested by the purchaser.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirement to provide receipt, bill or invoice — online marketplace facilitator
bcl:section.bcl:text: An online marketplace facilitator must provide a person with a receipt, bill or invoice if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the online marketplace facilitator facilitates through an online marketplace a sale, provision or lease to the person in respect of which the online marketplace facilitator is a collector, and
that person requests a receipt, bill or invoice.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax to be shown on receipt, bill or invoice

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector must show the tax imposed under the Act that is levied by the collector as a separate item on a receipt, bill or invoice if the collector

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: levies tax imposed under the Act in relation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a sale or provision of tangible personal property, software or a taxable service at a retail sale, or
a lease of tangible personal property to a lessee, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to the sale, provision or lease.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than a collector, who sells liquor by auction must show the tax imposed under the Act that is levied by the person in relation to the sale as a separate item on a receipt, bill or invoice provided if that person provides a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to the sale.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Registration number to be shown on receipt,
bill, invoice or written agreement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a collector if the collector

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provides a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to a sale or provision of tangible personal property, software or a taxable service or a lease of tangible personal property to a lessee, or
enters into a written agreement with a purchaser of tangible personal property, software or a taxable service or a lessee of tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector to whom this section applies obtains a person's registration number in accordance with section 37 (3), (5), (6) or (7), 49 (10), (11) or (12), 92 (2), 93 (4), 123.1 or 130 (2.1) of the Act, the collector must record the person's registration number on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement.

Despite subsection (2), a collector to whom that subsection applies may record the number of a licence issued under the Liquor Control and Licensing Act to a person on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement instead of the person's registration number if the collector

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sells to the person, or, if the collector is an online marketplace facilitator, facilitates the sale to the person of, liquor that will be sold or served under the person's licence, and
obtains, in addition to obtaining the person's registration number, the number of the licence issued under that Act to the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (2), a collector to whom that subsection applies may record the number of a licence issued under the Cannabis Control and Licensing Act to a person on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement instead of the person's registration number if the collector

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sells to the person, or, if the collector is an online marketplace facilitator, facilitates the sale to the person of, cannabis that will be sold under the person's licence, and
obtains, in addition to obtaining the person's registration number, the number of the licence issued under that Act to the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector to whom this section applies obtains, in accordance with section 37 (4) (a), 39 (4) (a) or 49 (9.1) (a) of the Act, the account number referred to in that section that is assigned to a person, the collector must record the person's account number on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement.

If a collector to whom this section applies obtains a person's registration number in accordance with section 130 (3) (b) or 134.3 (4) (b) of the Act and section 89 or 89.1 of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, the collector must record the person's registration number on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement.

If a collector to whom this section applies obtains a person's registration number in accordance with section 145 (1.1) (b) of the Act and section 31 (3), 33 (4), 62, 63 or 70 of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, the collector must record the person's registration number on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement.

If a collector to whom this section applies obtains a person's registration number in accordance with section 145 (2) (b) of the Act and section 73 (3) of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, the collector must record the person's registration number on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement.

If a collector to whom this section applies obtains a person's registration number in accordance with section 119 (2), 130 (3), 134.3 (4) or 145 (1.1) or (2) of the Act because the registration number is information required by the director, the collector must record the person's registration number on the receipt, bill, invoice or written agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Information respecting modified motor vehicle or modified
business vehicle shown on receipt, bill or invoice

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) applies to the following collectors:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a collector who sells a modified motor vehicle to a person at a retail sale in British Columbia;
a collector who is an online marketplace facilitator and who facilitates the sale of a modified motor vehicle at a retail sale in British Columbia;
a collector who causes a modified motor vehicle to be delivered into British Columbia to a person;
a collector who leases a modified motor vehicle to a lessee;
a collector who is an online marketplace facilitator and who facilitates the lease of a modified motor vehicle to a lessee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector described in subsection (0.1) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide the person with a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to the sale or lease, and
record on the receipt, bill or invoice the portion of the price that can reasonably be attributed to those special features or modifications of the vehicle for which the sole purpose is to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: facilitate the use of the vehicle by, or the transportation of, an individual using a wheelchair, or
equip the vehicle with an auxiliary driving control that facilitates the operation of the vehicle by an individual with a disability.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector who sells or, if the collector is an online marketplace facilitator, facilitates the sale of a modified business vehicle to a person at a retail sale in British Columbia or causes a modified business vehicle to be delivered into British Columbia to a person must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide the person with a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to the sale, and

record on the receipt, bill or invoice the portion of the price that can reasonably be attributed to the modifications referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of "modified business vehicle" in section 1 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector who leases or, if the collector is an online marketplace facilitator, facilitates the lease of a modified business vehicle to a lessee must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that person with a receipt, bill or invoice in relation to the lease, and

record on the receipt, bill or invoice the portion of the fair market value of the modified business vehicle that can reasonably be attributed to the modifications referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of "modified business vehicle" in section 1 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Collector records

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, collector includes an online marketplace seller who would be a collector but for section 179.3 (1) (b) of the Act.
A collector must keep records of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total value of the consideration accepted by the collector from a sale or lease of tangible personal property;
the total value of the consideration accepted by the collector from a sale or provision of software or a taxable service;
the total value of the consideration accepted by the collector from all sales or leases of tangible personal property;
the total value of the consideration accepted by the collector from all sales or provisions of software or taxable services;
the amount of tax levied or collected under the Act;
the amount of tax remitted under the Act;
a taxable sale, provision or lease of tangible personal property;
a taxable sale or provision of software or a taxable service;
a non-taxable sale of tangible personal property, including sales for resale;
a non-taxable sale of accommodation, including sales for resale;
a price reduction in relation to a sale or lease of tangible personal property;
a price reduction in relation to a sale or provision of software or a taxable service;
a refund or credit provided in relation to a sale or lease of tangible personal property, including the amount of the refund or credit;
a refund or credit provided in relation to a sale or provision of software or a taxable service, including the amount of the refund or credit;

an exemption from tax under the Act allowed in relation to a sale or lease of tangible personal property, including information and documents obtained in accordance with the Act from a person alleging that the person is exempt from tax;

an exemption from tax under the Act allowed in relation to a sale or provision of software or a taxable service, including information and documents obtained in accordance with the Act from a person alleging that the person is exempt from tax;
tangible personal property brought or sent into British Columbia, or for which delivery is received in British Columbia, for sale or lease;

tangible personal property purchased or taken from inventory in British Columbia by the collector for the collector's own use or consumption, or supplied to the collector's employees if the supply has not been included as a retail sale;

software or a taxable service purchased or taken from inventory in British Columbia by the collector for the collector's use or benefit, or supplied to the collector's employees if the supply has not been included as a retail sale;

registration numbers, declarations and other information and documents obtained in accordance with section 37 (3), (4), (5), (6) or (7), 39 (4), 44 (2), 49 (9.1), (10), (11) or (12), 92 (2), 93 (4), 95 (3), 105 (3), 119 (2), 123.1, 130 (2.1) or (3), 134.3 (4) or 145 (1.1) or (2) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector must keep an entry in a record referred to in subsection (1) separate and distinguishable from other entries in the record.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of holder of liquor permit
bcl:section.bcl:text: A holder of a liquor permit, other than a holder who is a collector, must keep records sufficient to furnish the director with the necessary particulars of sales of liquor under the permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of person who sells liquor by auction
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person, other than a collector, who sells liquor by auction must keep records sufficient to furnish the director with the necessary particulars of sales of liquor by auction.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of online marketplace facilitator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An online marketplace facilitator who is a collector must keep, in addition to the records referred to in section 88 [collector records], the records set out in subsection (2) in respect of each online marketplace seller for whom

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the online marketplace facilitator facilitates a sale, provision or lease of tangible personal property, software or taxable services, other than legal services, and
the online marketplace facilitator is a collector in respect of the sale, provision or lease of tangible personal property, software or taxable services, other than legal services.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following records are required for the purposes of subsection (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the online marketplace seller's name or business name, address and contact information;
the online marketplace seller's business number as defined in the Income Tax Act (Canada), if the online marketplace seller is located in Canada and has a business number;
the online marketplace seller's federal employer identification number, if the online marketplace seller is located in the United States of America;

the total amount of payment collected by the online marketplace facilitator and transmitted to the online marketplace seller in respect of all of the online marketplace seller's sales, provisions or leases for which the online marketplace facilitator is a collector;
the amount of tax levied or collected by the online marketplace facilitator in respect of the online marketplace seller;
the amount of tax that the online marketplace facilitator has remitted to the government in respect of the online marketplace seller.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of online marketplace seller
bcl:section.bcl:text: An online marketplace facilitator must keep records of the total value of consideration accepted by the online marketplace seller for each sale, provision or lease of tangible personal property, software or taxable services, other than legal services, facilitated by an online marketplace facilitator, if the sale, provision or lease is taxable or exempt under the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Small seller records
bcl:section.bcl:text: A small seller must keep records sufficient to furnish the director with the necessary particulars of sales of eligible tangible personal property or software or provisions of taxable services.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Independent sales contractor records
bcl:section.bcl:text: An independent sales contractor must keep records sufficient to furnish the director with the necessary particulars of sales of exclusive products and refunds and credits provided in relation to sales of exclusive products.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of person who must self-assess tax
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who is required to file a taxpayer return under section 29, 31 or 192 of the Act must keep records of the following as each relates to the taxpayer return:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person's purchase of tangible personal property, software or a taxable service at a retail sale in British Columbia;
tangible personal property brought or sent into British Columbia or for which delivery is received in British Columbia;
a vehicle, boat or aircraft received as a gift;
tangible personal property used in British Columbia;
software used in British Columbia;
the person's use of a taxable service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of person exempt from tax
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who is exempt from paying tax imposed under the Act must keep records sufficient to furnish the director with the necessary particulars of the exemption.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Retention of records

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who is required to keep records under the Act must retain the records for a period of 5 years from the date the record is created.

If a person who is required to retain records under subsection (1) makes a written application to the director for permission to destroy a record, the director may authorize the requested destruction prior to the expiry of the period described in subsection (1).

Despite any other provision of this section, if a record might be necessary for the purposes of an appeal under section 211 [appeal to minister] or 212 [appeal to court] of the Act, the person required to keep records must retain the record after the expiry of the period described in subsection (1) and until the appeals have been exhausted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Information returns of online marketplace facilitators

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An online marketplace facilitator who is a collector must file an information return with the director on an annual basis.
The information return must be filed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on or before August 31 of each year for the period beginning on July 1 of the previous year and ending on June 30 of the year, and
in the form and manner specified by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The information return must contain the information set out in subsection (3.1) in respect of each marketplace seller for whom

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the online marketplace facilitator facilitates a sale, provision or lease of tangible personal property, software or taxable services, other than legal services, and
the online marketplace facilitator is a collector in respect of the sale, provision or lease of tangible personal property, software or taxable services, other than legal services.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following records are required for the purposes of subsection (3):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the online marketplace seller's name or business name, address and contact information;
the online marketplace seller's business number as defined in the Income Tax Act (Canada), if the online marketplace seller is located in Canada and has a business number;
the online marketplace seller's federal employer identification number, if the online marketplace seller is located in the United States of America;

the total amount of payment collected by the online marketplace facilitator and transmitted to the online marketplace seller in respect of all of the online marketplace seller's sales, provisions or leases for which the online marketplace facilitator is a collector;
the amount of tax levied or collected by the online marketplace facilitator in respect of the online marketplace seller;
the amount of tax that the online marketplace facilitator has remitted to the government in respect of the online marketplace seller.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The information return must contain the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total value of the consideration accepted by the online marketplace facilitator from all of the online marketplace facilitator's sales, provisions or leases through an online marketplace of tangible personal property, software or taxable services, other than legal services, that are taxable or exempt under the Act;
the total value of the consideration accepted by the online marketplace facilitator from all sales or provisions of online marketplace services that are taxable or exempt under the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed circumstance for penalty under section 204 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 204 (1) of the Act, the prescribed circumstance is a circumstance in which

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person declares that the person would be exempt under Part 5 [Production Machinery and Equipment] of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, other than section 112 [software related to qualifying machinery or equipment] or 113 [services related to qualifying machinery or equipment], if the person were to purchase the tangible personal property, or

the person declares that the person would be exempt under Part 5 of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, other than section 112 or 113, if the person were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Prescribed circumstance and amount for penalty under
section 205 of Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 205 (c) (i) of the Act, the prescribed circumstance is the failure to remit tax in accordance with the manner prescribed in section 73 (1) (a) of this regulation.
For the purposes of section 205 (c) (i) of the Act, the prescribed amount is 5% of the amount not remitted in accordance with the manner prescribed in section 73 (1) (a) of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Calculation of interest
bcl:section.bcl:text: Interest payable under the Act must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: compounded monthly, and
calculated on the number of days since the last compounding of interest, or if no compounding has yet occurred, from the date that interest is payable under the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definition
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division, client has the same meaning as in section 244 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Retention or seizure of records for which
solicitor-client privilege is claimed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is about to inspect, audit or examine a record that is in the possession of a lawyer and the lawyer claims that a client of the lawyer has a solicitor-client privilege in respect of the record,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director must not inspect, audit or examine the record, and
the lawyer must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: place the record in a package, together with any other records in respect of which the lawyer at the same time makes the same claim on behalf of the same client,
suitably seal and identify the package or, if the director and the lawyer agree, allow pages of the record to be initialled and numbered or otherwise suitably identified, and

retain the package and ensure that the package is preserved until the package is produced to a court under section 99 or 100 and an order under that section is made in respect of the record or until the record is otherwise dealt with in accordance with this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person acting under the authority of a warrant in relation to a possible contravention of the Act or regulations under the Act is about to seize a record that is in the possession of a lawyer and the lawyer claims that a client of the lawyer has a solicitor-client privilege in respect of the record,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person seizing the record must not inspect, examine or make copies of the record, and
that person must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: seize the record and place the record in a package, together with any other records subject to seizure in respect of which the lawyer at the same time makes the same claim on behalf of the same client,
suitably seal and identify the package, and
place the package in the custody of a sheriff or, if the lawyer and that person agree in writing on another person to act as custodian, in the custody of that other person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), if a record is in electronic form only, the lawyer must make a copy of the record in printed, electronic or other form and the person required to place the record in a package must include in the package either the original record or the copy.
A lawyer who makes a claim under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make a reasonable effort to inform the client of the claim, and
advise the director in writing as to whether the lawyer informed the client of the claim and, if the client was informed, whether the client waives the claim of solicitor-client privilege.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Custody of seized documents while claim determined

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The custodian of a record seized under section 98 (2) must not deliver the record to any person except

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in accordance with an order under section 100 or 101,
to the lawyer in accordance with a written consent of the director, or
to the director in accordance with a written consent of the lawyer or the client.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: At any time while a record seized under section 98 (2) is in the custody of a custodian, the lawyer who made the claim under that section may apply to the Supreme Court without notice to any other person for an order that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorizes the lawyer to examine or make a copy of the record in the presence of the custodian or a judge of the court, and
contains provisions that the court considers necessary to ensure that the record is repackaged and the package resealed without alteration or damage.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If any question arises as to the course to be followed in connection with anything done or being done under this section or section 100 or 101 and there is no direction in this section or section 100 or 101 on the matter, on application, the Supreme Court may give such direction as is in the court's opinion most likely to carry out the object of sections 98 to 101 of allowing solicitor-client privilege for proper purposes.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to court by lawyer or client

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 14 days after a record is retained under section 98 (1) or seized under section 98 (2), the lawyer or the client may apply to the Supreme Court by way of a petition proceeding for a determination of whether the client has solicitor-client privilege with respect to the record.
In the petition filed under subsection (1), the government must be designated "Her Majesty the Queen in right of the Province of British Columbia".
Within 7 days after the filing of the petition under subsection (1), the petition must be served on the government in accordance with section 8 of the Crown Proceeding Act.
If the person who filed the petition under subsection (1) sets the matter down for hearing, that person must, at least 7 days before the date set for the hearing,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: serve a notice of hearing on the government and on the custodian of the record, if any, and
pay to the custodian, if any, the estimated expenses of transporting the record to and from the place of hearing and of safeguarding the record.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The hearing of an application must exclude the public if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lawyer or the client requests that the public be excluded, or
the court orders that the public be excluded.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the hearing of an application, the court must,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the court decides that the client has solicitor-client privilege with respect to the record, order the release of the record to the lawyer or the client, or
if the court decides that the client does not have solicitor-client privilege with respect to the record,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of a record retained under section 98 (1), order that the lawyer make the record available for inspection, audit or examination by the director, or
in the case of a record seized under section 98 (2), order the custodian to deliver the record to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The court may inspect the record if the court considers this necessary for the purposes of subsection (6) of this section and, if the inspection is done, the court must ensure that the record is repackaged and the package resealed and the reasons for judgment must not divulge any details of the record.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to court by government

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The government may apply to the Supreme Court for an order under this section if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no application under section 100 (1) is commenced within the time limit set by that section in relation to a record that was retained or seized, or

the person bringing an application under section 100 does not set the matter down to be heard on a date no later than 30 days after the commencement of the application or a later date agreed to by the government.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The government must give notice of the hearing to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lawyer, and
the client, if the identity of the client is known to the government.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the identity of the client is not known to the government, a lawyer who is given notice of the hearing under subsection (2) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make reasonable efforts to give notice of the hearing to the client, and
advise the court as to whether the lawyer gave notice of the hearing to the client.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A client who is given notice of the hearing under subsection (3) is deemed to have been given notice of the hearing by the government.
On the hearing of an application under this section, the court may,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a record retained under section 98 (1), order that the lawyer make the record available for inspection, audit or examination by the director, or
in the case of a record seized under section 98 (2), order the custodian to deliver the record to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Certificate of lien form
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 221 (2) (a) of the Act, a certificate of lien must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form specified by the director, and
include at least the following information:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the person against whom the lien is being registered;
information sufficient to identify the real property against which the lien is being registered;
the amount remaining unpaid or unremitted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Information sharing — prescribed enactments
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 228 (5) (l) [information sharing] of the Act, the following enactments are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Business Number Act;
the Civil Forfeiture Act;
section 8 of the Financial Administration Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Offences and penalties

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the first conviction, to a fine of not less than $200 and not more than $500, and
on a subsequent conviction for contravention of the same or another provision of this regulation, to a fine of not less than $500 and not more than $2 000.
